intro: Ferocactus gatesii, commonly known as the Gates' barrel cactus, is a species native to the Sonoran Desert in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a robust, columnar cactus with a thick, ribbed stem that can grow up to 6 feet tall. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are borne on long, slender stems. Its spines are typically pale yellow to brown, providing protection from herbivores and reducing water loss. Ferocactus gatesii is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its fleshy stem and having a shallow root system to maximize water absorption.
